name: Susan Eisenberg
bio: Susan Eisenberg is a poet, visual artist, and oral historian who works within and across genres. She is the author of the poetry collections Stanley's Girl (2018) and Pioneering: Poems from the Construction Site (1998), and the prose book We'll Call You If We Need You: Experiences of Women Working Construction (2018). Her work reimagines the everyday, playing with scale and juxtaposition to investigate issues of power and social policy. She has published articles and essays in the Nation, Working Mother, UTNE Reader, and Sojourner. She lives in Boston, where she teaches writing and theatre. As a long-term activist, she speaks nationally on gender issues in the workplace.
